AppStateClient.Builder(android.content.C.Description: Create a new Builder object to be used to build a corresponding AppStateClient object.

create().Description: Creates a new AppStateClient object to be used to communicate with the App State service, requesting all of the scopes passed in. The object is not usable until after the asynchronous @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateClient#connect_E@ method has been called and your listener's @B_com#google#android#gms#common#GooglePlayServicesClient#ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected_E@ method is called. Note that the ConnectionCallbacks provided here will always receive callbacks before any subsequently registered connection listeners. When your application is done using this client it must call @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateClient#disconnect_E@, even if the async result from @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateClient#connect_E@ has not yet been delivered. The typical pattern is to instantiate this object in your Activity's @B_android#app#Activity#onCreate_E@ method and then call @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateClient#connect_E@ in @B_android#app#Activity#onStart_E@ and @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateClient#disconnect_E@ from @B_android#app#Activity#onStop_E@ regardless of the state.

Parameters: The account name on the device that should be used by this @B_com#google#android#gms#appstate#AppStateClient_E@. Must be non-null.
setAccountName(java.lang.String).Description: Specify an account name on the device that should be used. If this is never called, the client will use the current default account for Google Play services for this application.

Parameters: The OAuth scopes that your application is requesting access to (see @B_com#google#android#gms#common#Scopes_E@ for details).
setScopes(java.lang.String...).Description: Set the scopes to use when building the AppStateClient object. The scope used by default is @B_com#google#android#gms#common#Scopes#APP_STATE_E@.
